Authors:
Yousuke Degawa, Tsuyoshi Hosoya, Kentaro Hosaka, Yumiko
Hirayama, Yukiko Saito, Yanjie Zhao
Title: Re-evaluation of Roesleria subterranea from Japan
Abstract:
Roesleria subterranea, a distinctive hypogeous fungus was
collected from unidentified deciduous plant root in red pine forest. The
fungus had been documented several times in the past in Japan, but with
no definitive description. Description is given based on voucher
specimen. The sequence of D1D2 region of nuclear large subunit of
ribosomal DNA (LSU) obtained from the isolate was identical to European
and American specimens. Maximum parsimony analysis incorporating all
available ITS-5.8S sequences of R. subterranea resulted in two groups.
One composed of the isolates from Vitis spp. in Germany while the other
composed of isolates from various deciduous trees in various countries.
The Japanese isolate was incorporated to the latter group, suggesting
that the host selectivity was more effective in evolution of R.
subterranea than geographical distance.
